programme.title: Venturing Out: Park 2 Park
programme.desc: In mile-high alpine forests near Grand Junction, Raheim encourages IT analyst Bill to get back on the bike following an accident that left him with multiple broken bones. They also ride ski lifts, kayak lakes of snowmelt, and sip lavender gin.

programme.title: Venturing Out: Park 2 Park
programme.desc: Touring Delaware, Raheim pushes Tatyanna to her limits above the trees before coming back to the ground to get a little history lesson and a fantastic local brew. And in this episode of firsts, Raheim is on his own to catch some waves.

programme.title: Venturing Out: Park 2 Park
programme.sub-title: Tackling Snow, Sand, & Cold in Southern Utah
programme.desc: Raheim Robinson meets up with his buddy Clark Robinson (and no, they’re not related) to see if their shared passion for outdoor adventures will endure three climates across three Counties in three days.

programme.title: Venturing Out: Park 2 Park
programme.desc: In El Paso, Texas, Raheim coaches new mom and aspiring mountain biker Isabel as she rides rocky desert descents in the Franklin Mountains. Then, Raheim visits an ancient bouldering field, Hueco Tanks, home to wild west graffiti and rock art.

programme.title: Love On the Rocks
programme.desc: A romantic trip to Colorado takes a windy turn when Jason pushes Tayler, despite her hesitation, to summit Mt. Democrat in 70 mph winds and -19 degree weather.

programme.title: Love On the Rocks
programme.desc: Jason loves mountain biking. Tayler prefers to read a book. Jason is up for any adventure tossed at him. Tayler likes to be a bit more prepared. Will the adventures that await in Arkansas leave the couple questioning if they have anything in common?

programme.title: Love On the Rocks
programme.desc: Tayler and Jason travel to Eureka Springs, Arkansas, a town with a rich history and home to one of the most haunted hotels in America, The Crescent. Jason convinces Tayler to stay one night, but will that stay lead to a night they don't want to remember?

programme.title: Love On the Rocks
programme.desc: Jason experiences insecurity about challenges that the couple are, quite literally, dropped into. From falling out of the sky to a rappel into a dark cave, will the couple be able to work together or will they end up stranded in the dark?

programme.title: National Parks Adventure
programme.desc: A team of modern day explorers take an off-trail adventure through the national parks of the USA, showing the awe-inspiring beauty found within America’s most legendary outdoor playgrounds.

programme.title: Facing Waves
programme.desc: Ken Whiting travels to Juneau, Alaska to paddle with whales, bears, glaciers and icebergs on a multi-day sea kayaking adventure.

programme.title: USA Through Music
programme.desc: American cities have long played a starring role in its music. Notable musicians tell personal stories about how their favorite cities inspire their work.

programme.title: Beach Battles
programme.desc: Dive into the fun blowing conchs in Key West, Florida and race pro SUPS in Wrightsville Beach, North Carolina.

programme.title: Beach Battles
programme.desc: Coney Island, New York hosts its annual Mermaid Parade, and sand sculpting pros battle in Manitowoc, Wisconsin.

programme.title: Beach Battles
programme.sub-title: Beach Battles: Winchester Bay & Long Beach
programme.desc: High-octane dune racing in Winchester Bay, Oregon, plus high-flying Kitefest fun in Long Beach, Washington.

programme.title: Beach Battles
programme.desc: Paddle into Dog Surfing in Pacifica, California, and get picking at the Crab Derby in Crisfield, Maryland.

programme.title: USA Through Film 2
programme.desc: Actor and director Jordan Spiro (Ozark, Night Comes On) spent childhood vacations with her family in New Orleans. For Spiro, the city’s heritage as the birthplace of jazz is reflected in its mélange of arts and food culture that always feels fresh, inviting, and joyous, even after a lifetime of visits. “There’s this ‘all senses on overload’ side to New Orleans that takes my breath away every time.”

programme.title: Epic Southern Road Trip
programme.desc: The next stop on Sorted Food's Epic Southern Road Trip is Savannah, Georgia. In 48 hours they must learn all they can about local culture and cuisine before hosting a dinner party for local chefs to showcase what they’ve learned about Southern food and hospitality. Will the guys be able to learn enough in such a short period of time?

programme.title: Epic Southern Road Trip
programme.desc: After exploring Savannah, Georgia for 48 hours learning the ropes of Southern food and hospitality, Chef Ben, Jamie and Mike try hosting a dinner party for local chefs, food writers and Savannah natives. How will these expectant locals react?

programme.title: Sorted Food: Game Changers
programme.sub-title: Puerto Rico Street Food Face Off
programme.desc: Sorted heads to Puerto Rico to find the best food this beautiful island has to offer.

programme.title: Epic Trails: Backpacking West Virginia
programme.desc: Eric Hanson explores the mountains, trails and winter landscapes of West Virginia.

programme.title: One Perfect Day in Kentucky
programme.desc: In "One Perfect Day in Kentucky," BFF’s Kimberly and Elsa bring their shared competitive streak to the Bluegrass State, facing off to find out who can plan the perfect Kentucky day. Each is determined to delight - and outdo - the other with unforgettable experiences that showcase the state's rich culture. Elsa kicks off the competition with a classic Kentucky breakfast, a recipe she learned from top Chef Ouita Michel at her Holly Hill Cooking Studio. Elsa wins the first point, but Kimberly’s ready to up the ante, whisking Elsa away for a thrilling cave kayaking adventure at the Gorge Underground. As they ride the chairlift to the top of the stunning Natural Bridge, the rivalry kicks into high gear and they go head-to-head in a trivia battle. The next surprise – a toast with Kentucky’s own Ale-8 soda , sourced by Kimberly straight from the factory only whets their whistles. At the Keeneland Racetrack they sip some spirit forward Keeneland Breezes while Elsa reveals all she has learned about racehorses from a visit to renowned trainer Mark Simms Jr. ‘s horse barn. A Betologist gives them a quick lesson on wagering and Kimberly’s horse wins the race. At Louisville’s Trouble Bar, Kimberly shares her newfound knowledge of Kentucky bourbon production from a tour and tasting at Castle + Key distillery and makes Elsa One Perfect Drink.

programme.title: Adventure Cities
programme.desc: Jonathan Thompson explores the adventurous side of St. Petersburg Clearwater, Florida; Charleston, South Carolina; and Juneau, Alaska.

programme.title: America's Musical Journey
programme.desc: A cross-country adventure through the musical heritage of America and the cultural cities where America's music was born.

programme.title: American Beats
programme.desc: Kansas City, Missouri, is an integral part of jazz history in America. Shaped by legends who once graced its streets, it is bursting with deep history, mouth-watering cuisine and a lively jazz scene. World-renowned trumpeter, tap dancer, and entertainer, Lonnie McFadden and celebrated singer and tap dancer Chloe McFadden, show Chunz and Makh what it’s all about. From finger-licking barbecue to sports events and a bustling nightlife, this city is a cultural hub offering endless opportunities for a fun-filled getaway.

programme.title: Small Town, Big Story
programme.desc: One day each year in Fayetteville, West Virginia, scores of people throw caution to the wind and jump off a 876' bridge into the Gorge below.

programme.title: Small Town, Big Story
programme.desc: We learn the kite ballet and soar to new heights at the annual kite-festival in the blustery sea-side town of Morro Bay.

programme.title: Notes from the USA
programme.sub-title: Notes from the USA: Baton Rouge
programme.desc: Foy explores the influence of Creole and Cajun cultures on the songs and the seafood coming out of Baton Rouge, Louisiana.

programme.title: Notes from the USA
programme.desc: Foy explores how the local landscape and indigenous communities have shaped Phoenix's musical identity.

programme.title: Sorted Food Goes Big in Texas
programme.desc: Chef Ben and his three foodie friends are on a mission to explore the BIGGEST and BEST food in Texas through a series of food challenges. They begin their journey in San Antonio, home to Big Lou's huge 62 inch pizza.

programme.title: Sorted Food Goes Big in Texas
programme.desc: Chef Ben and the guys continue their Texas adventure in San Antonio, with a quick stop in the coastal city of Corpus Christi.

programme.title: Sorted Food Goes Big in Texas
programme.desc: Chef Ben and the gang arrive in Texas’ BIGGEST city, Houston. With new challenges in store, will they level the leaderboard?

programme.title: Sorted Food Goes Big in Texas
programme.desc: The Sorted guys go head to head in a street food fusion battle in Texas’ BIGGEST city, Houston. Who will come out on top?!

programme.title: Epic Trails
programme.desc: Eric explores Utah’s breathtaking slot canyons on a multi-day backpacking adventure.

programme.title: Epic Trails
programme.desc: Eric travels to the mountain towns of Durango and Telluride, Colorado to explore the backcountry by ski, snowshoe, and ice axe.

programme.title: Paul & Nicks Big American Food Trip: South Portland
programme.desc: Paul and Nick meet Mary Drymon, who has written about how Scottish and Ulster food traditions have widely influenced how America eats today. We’re on the coast of New England, so expect some lobster to feature…

programme.title: Paul & Nick's Big American Food Trip
programme.desc: Paul and Nick cook for friends of the Scots’ Charitable Society, the oldest charity in America, set up to help fund the education of Scots in America. They are charmed by an ex-pat who teaches Scottish dancing, and they discover a local butcher who finds it hard to think of the words ‘Scots’ and ‘charitable’ in the same sentence!

programme.title: Lucky in Love
programme.desc: Rachel and Paul go on a journey of discovery, luck and love through the Big Easy.

programme.title: Lucky in Love
programme.desc: Alana and Josh try their luck in Fort Worth, Texas, where cowboys and cosmopolitans walk hand in hand.

programme.title: Lucky in Love
programme.desc: Gary and Dean go on a game of chance in America’s capital.

programme.title: Adventure Cities Sacramento to Longbeach
programme.desc: Seasoned travel writer Jonathan Thompson sets out to explore the adventurous sides of Sacramento, Long Beach California and Portland Oregon.

programme.title: Ellis Family Vacation
programme.desc: The Ellis Family road trips to the Grand Canyon and Zion National Park in search of some outdoor fun.

programme.title: Ellis Family Vacation
programme.desc: The Ellis Family ventures to the Big Easy, soaking up the culture of New Orleans with jazz, beignets, airboat adventures, and more.

programme.title: Ellis Family Vacation
programme.desc: The Ellis Family explores Washington D.C., discovering monuments, Ford’s Theatre, and the best cupcakes in the capital!

programme.title: Ellis Family Vacation
programme.desc: The Ellis Family checks out Birmingham, Alabama, ground zero of the Civil Rights Movement, visiting museums, monuments, and locations that helped end segregation in the United States.

programme.title: USA Through Food
programme.desc: A journey through the USA, through the diverse food scenes of six vibrant cities.

programme.title: Paul & Nick's Big American Food Trip
programme.sub-title: Paul & Nicks Big American Food Trip: York County SC
programme.desc: The chefs head for York County in the central region of the South Carolina Piedmont or ‘foothills’ to cook for descendants of the influential Bratton family. They visit the producer of the hottest chili pepper in the world, get a taste for the Carolina peach and find out about the State’s tradition of ‘slow and low’ barbecue.

programme.title: Paul & Nick's Big American Food Trip
programme.desc: The chefs head to the city of Knoxville, East Tennessee to meet and cook for descendants of the first Ulster-Scots settlers in the area – the Ramseys and the Whites. They hit the Market Square Farmers’ Market in downtown Knoxville and visit a 6th generation farmer to find some great beef and they take a trip to a dairy farm to taste some local buttermilk…

programme.title: Cheat Meal
programme.desc: Tyler and Monica head to Virginia Beach where they’re tasked by celebrity chef Cliff Crooks to create the ultimate cheat meal for a local restaurateur. Armed with the power of their taste buds, the dynamic duo checks out the best places to eat, including Oishii Burger, Chick’s Oyster Bar and Klassic Doughnuts, to build an off-the-charts meal of epic portions.

programme.title: Cheat Meal
programme.desc: Tyler and Monica dive back into Virginia Beach's vibrant food scene to build the ultimate cheat meal for George Culver, the food-loving force behind the popular @iheartfoodvb. From the tropical vibes at Moxy Virginia Beach to the game-filled hangouts at Beachside Social, and the delightful flavors of Oh Mochi, De Rican Chef, and Belvedere South, they pull out all the stops to craft a meal that’s as unforgettable as it is indulgent!

programme.title: Sorted Food Goes Big in Texas
programme.desc: The Sorted guys make it to North Central Texas and take on a round of foodie challenges in the "Big D".

programme.title: Sorted Food Goes Big in Texas
programme.desc: Continuing their culinary adventure in North Central Texas, the guys take on challenges just west of Dallas in Fort Worth.

programme.title: Sorted Food Goes Big in Texas
programme.sub-title: Sorted Food Goes Big in Texas: Austin Part 1
programme.desc: Chef Ben and the guys explore Austin, the final city in their Texan adventure.

programme.title: Sorted Food Goes Big in Texas
programme.sub-title: Sorted Food Goes Big in Texas: Austin Part 2
programme.desc: Chef Ben and the guys explore Austin, their final city in their Texan adventure, with the winner of their HUGE challenge revealed!

programme.title: Small Town, Big Story
programme.desc: Dylan discovers Kennett Square, Pennsylvania, a vibrant town producing over 70% of America’s mushrooms.

programme.title: Small Town, Big Story
programme.desc: If there's one thing that the town of Abbeville can teach you, it's that you can’t make a good Cajun omelet without breaking a 'few' eggs - over 5,000 of them.

programme.title: Small Town, Big Story
programme.desc: Dylan explores the world of Hatch chilis and meets the farmers and community in this New Mexico valley known for bringing these unique peppers to life - one tingly, tasty, spicy bite at a time.

programme.title: Destination Route 66: Great Stays
programme.desc: Rest your head after a long day driving Route 66. Check in to these great accommodations along the way!

programme.title: Destination Route 66: Great Stays
programme.desc: Rest your head after a long day driving Route 66. Check in to these great accommodations along the way!

programme.title: Destination Route 66: Scenic Wonders
programme.desc: Mother Nature along the Mother Road. Check out these can’t miss natural wonders on Route 66.

programme.title: Just Landed
programme.desc: Jim kicks off his journey in Virginia Beach, a coastal gem with a deep-rooted fishing heritage. But Mother Nature has her own plans—as storm clouds roll in, Jim has a challenge ahead: tagging his first Redfish for NOAA to help track its migration.

programme.title: USA Through Food
programme.desc: A journey through the USA, through the diverse food scenes of six vibrant cities.

programme.title: It All Begins With A Song
programme.desc: A film about one of the most important and unknown forces in music: The Nashville Songwriter. With over 50 masters: Ben Folds, Garth Brooks, Brad Paisley, Luke Bryan, Rodney Crowell, Kacey Musgraves, John Hiatt, Keb Mo, Liz Rose, Claude Kelly and more!
